pageContext.claim: “NAFTA was a defective deal the day it was signed. You know why? Because they had a VAT tax of 17% and nobody from this country knew that. By the time they found out, which was about a week later, nobody went and changed it. So you went many years and they never changed it. There was a VAT tax that Mexico got. So we were 17 points or 16 points behind before we even started.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referencing Mexico's 16 percent VAT tax. Mexican companies are subject to the tax, just as U.S. companies are. Therefore, experts say, it's not a trade barrier.
